page.title: 17Wootton Residential Visit
page.content: In May 1985,twelve school children went on a residential visit to Weston- Super-Mare.We travelled down by mini-bus.On the way we stopped at Bibury,and the Roman town Cirencester. At Weston we stayed at the Sandy Lodge Hotel.We visited lots of interesting places.We went to see a lifeboat station,as well as seeing Cheddar Gorge we also saw the caves at Wookey Hole which were formed over one million years ago. We also saw the Roman Baths in Bath(Aquae Sulis).Visits were also made to Bristol Zoo and the S.S. Great Britain.The weather was fine and everyone enjoyed themselves.
